medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hypercalcemia first noticed in 1999 with mild elevation of serum calcium. She had previously been treated with bisphosphonates since 1999 without significant changes in serum calcium levels. Findings of long-standing mild hypercalcemia suggest familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia. Evaluation revealed mild hypercalcemia with normal serum PTH levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of metastatic breast cancer, having undergone mastectomy and lymph node resection in 1987, followed by chemotherapy and irradiation. Further chemotherapy was administered in 1996 for metastatic disease.
medical_history.family_history: Three of five relatives had mild hypercalcemia; however, the family history was apparently negative for hypercalcemia.
